content.description: 01/29/21 Update: Top out is super blank and tried in great conditions. Might not go and if it does, quite a bit harder than the guesstimate of v7. Unsent as of yet but starts matched on a head high side pull moving through another sidepull into an impossible looking sequence to get you to the lip- all with no feet! Probably clocks in at v1 for your average font climber but at least v6/7+ for everyone else. Landing is great and flat. Let me know if you send it or it will be updated soon.
content.location: Vert face on the east side of the egg boulder.

content.description: 01/29/21 Update: Top out is super blank and tried in great conditions. Might not go and if it does, quite a bit harder than the guesstimate of v7.Unsent as of yet but starts sitting on two obvious sidepull crimps and moves up to a nice small crimp just over the bulge into a quite hard slab topout. Landing is to be desired, bring your pads and spotters for this one. Probably clocks in at v7ish but who knows, let me know if you send it or it will be updated soon.
content.location: Southwest side of the egg boulder on the arete/prow.

content.description: The namesake of the area. Quite rotund.
